verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after the year was expired, at the time when kings go forth to battle, that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried still at Jerusalem.
verses.web: At the return of the year, at the time when kings go out, David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: In the spring, when kings normally go out to war, David sent Joab along with his officers and the entire army of Israel. They crushed the Ammonites and laid siege to Rabbah. But David stayed behind in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in an eveningtide, that David arose from off his bed, and walked upon the roof of the king’s house: and from the roof he saw a woman washing herself; and the woman was very beautiful to look upon.
verses.web: At evening, David arose from his bed and walked on the roof of the king’s house. From the roof, he saw a woman bathing, and the woman was very beautiful to look at.
verses.ct: One evening, David got up from his bed and went for a walk on the roof of the palace. From the rooftop, he saw a woman bathing, and she was stunningly beautiful.

verses.kjv: And David sent and enquired after the woman. And one said, Is not this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?
verses.web: David sent and inquired after the woman. One said, “Isn’t this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, Uriah the Hittite’s wife?”
verses.ct: David sent someone to find out who she was. The report came back: "That's Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam. She's the wife of Uriah the Hittite."

verses.kjv: And David sent messengers, and took her; and she came in unto him, and he lay with her; for she was purified from her uncleanness: and she returned unto her house.
verses.web: David sent messengers, and took her; and she came in to him, and he lay with her (for she was purified from her uncleanness); and she returned to her house.
verses.ct: David sent messengers to bring her to him. She came to the palace, and he slept with her. She had just completed her purification after her monthly period. Then she went back home.

verses.kjv: And the woman conceived, and sent and told David, and said, I am with child.
verses.web: The woman conceived; and she sent and told David, and said, “I am with child.”
verses.ct: Bathsheba became pregnant. She sent word to David: "I am with child."

verses.kjv: And David sent to Joab, saying, Send me Uriah the Hittite. And Joab sent Uriah to David.
verses.web: David sent to Joab, “Send me Uriah the Hittite.” Joab sent Uriah to David.
verses.ct: David sent a message to Joab: "Send me Uriah the Hittite." So Joab sent Uriah to David.

verses.kjv: And when Uriah was come unto him, David demanded of him how Joab did, and how the people did, and how the war prospered.
verses.web: When Uriah had come to him, David asked him how Joab did, and how the people fared, and how the war prospered.
verses.ct: When Uriah arrived, David asked him how Joab was doing, how the troops were holding up, and how the war was going.

verses.kjv: And David said to Uriah, Go down to thy house, and wash thy feet. And Uriah departed out of the king’s house, and there followed him a mess of meat from the king.
verses.web: David said to Uriah, “Go down to your house and wash your feet.” Uriah departed out of the king’s house, and a gift from the king was sent after him.
verses.ct: Then David told Uriah, "Go home and relax." Uriah left the palace, and David sent a generous gift of food after him.

verses.kjv: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s house with all the servants of his lord, and went not down to his house.
verses.web: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s house with all the servants of his lord, and didn’t go down to his house.
verses.ct: But Uriah didn't go home. Instead, he slept at the entrance of the palace with the king's guards.

verses.kjv: And when they had told David, saying, Uriah went not down unto his house, David said unto Uriah, Camest thou not from thy journey? why then didst thou not go down unto thine house?
verses.web: When they had told David, saying, “Uriah didn’t go down to his house,” David said to Uriah, “Haven’t you come from a journey? Why didn’t you go down to your house?”
verses.ct: When David was told that Uriah hadn't gone home, he asked him, "You just got back from a long journey — why didn't you go home?"

verses.kjv: And Uriah said unto David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in tents; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open fields; shall I then go into mine house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? as thou livest, and as thy soul liveth, I will not do this thing.
verses.web: Uriah said to David, “The ark, Israel, and Judah, are staying in tents; and my lord Joab and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open field. Shall I then go into my house to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? As you live, and as your soul lives, I will not do this thing!”
verses.ct: Uriah answered David, "The ark, and the armies of Israel and Judah, are living in tents. My commander Joab and your soldiers are camped out in the open. How could I go home to eat and drink and sleep with my wife? As surely as you live, and as your soul lives, I will not do such a thing!"

verses.kjv: And David said to Uriah, Tarry here to day also, and to morrow I will let thee depart. So Uriah abode in Jerusalem that day, and the morrow.
verses.web: David said to Uriah, “Stay here today also, and tomorrow I will let you depart.” So Uriah stayed in Jerusalem that day, and the next day.
verses.ct: David said to Uriah, "Stay here one more day, and tomorrow I'll send you back." So Uriah remained in Jerusalem that day and the next.

verses.kjv: And when David had called him, he did eat and drink before him; and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but went not down to his house.
verses.web: When David had called him, he ate and drank before him; and he made him drunk. At evening, he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but didn’t go down to his house.
verses.ct: David invited Uriah to eat and drink with him, and got him drunk. But that evening Uriah still went out and slept with the king's guards instead of going home.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning, that David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
verses.web: In the morning, David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
verses.ct: The next morning, David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it with Uriah himself.

verses.kjv: And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.
verses.web: He wrote in the letter, saying, “Send Uriah to the forefront of the hottest battle, and retreat from him, that he may be struck, and die.”
verses.ct: In the letter he wrote: "Put Uriah at the front lines where the fighting is fiercest, then pull back from him so he gets struck down and killed."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joab observed the city, that he assigned Uriah unto a place where he knew that valiant men were.
verses.web: When Joab kept watch on the city, he assigned Uriah to the place where he knew that valiant men were.
verses.ct: So when Joab studied the city's defenses, he stationed Uriah at a spot where he knew the enemy's toughest warriors were positioned.

verses.kjv: And the men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell some of the people of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
verses.web: The men of the city went out, and fought with Joab. Some of the people fell, even of David’s servants; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
verses.ct: The men of the city charged out and fought against Joab's forces. Several of David's soldiers were killed — and Uriah the Hittite was among the dead.

verses.kjv: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war;
verses.web: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war;
verses.ct: Joab sent a messenger to report everything about the battle to David.

verses.kjv: And charged the messenger, saying, When thou hast made an end of telling the matters of the war unto the king,
verses.web: and he commanded the messenger, saying, “When you have finished telling all the things concerning the war to the king,
verses.ct: He instructed the messenger, "When you've finished giving the king the full battle report,

verses.kjv: And if so be that the king’s wrath arise, and he say unto thee, Wherefore approached ye so nigh unto the city when ye did fight? knew ye not that they would shoot from the wall?
verses.web: it shall be that, if the king’s wrath arise, and he asks you, ‘Why did you go so near to the city to fight? Didn’t you know that they would shoot from the wall?
verses.ct: if the king gets angry and demands, 'Why did you get so close to the city walls to fight? Didn't you know they'd shoot down at you from the wall?

verses.kjv: Who smote Abimelech the son of Jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piece of a millstone upon him from the wall, that he died in Thebez? why went ye nigh the wall? then say thou, Thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
verses.web: Who struck Abimelech the son of Jerubbesheth? Didn’t a woman cast an upper millstone on him from the wall, so that he died at Thebez? Why did you go so near the wall?’ then you shall say, ‘Your servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.’ ”
verses.ct: Who killed Abimelech son of Jerubbesheth? Wasn't it a woman who dropped a millstone on him from the wall at Thebez? Why did you go near the wall?' — then tell him, 'Your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead as well.'"

verses.kjv: So the messenger went, and came and shewed David all that Joab had sent him for.
verses.web: So the messenger went, and came and showed David all that Joab had sent him for.
verses.ct: The messenger went and delivered to David everything Joab had sent him to say.

verses.kjv: And the messenger said unto David, Surely the men prevailed against us, and came out unto us into the field, and we were upon them even unto the entering of the gate.
verses.web: The messenger said to David, “The men prevailed against us, and came out to us into the field, and we were on them even to the entrance of the gate.
verses.ct: The messenger told David, "The enemy overpowered us and came out to attack us in the open field. We drove them back all the way to the city gate,

verses.kjv: And the shooters shot from off the wall upon thy servants; and some of the king’s servants be dead, and thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
verses.web: The shooters shot at your servants from off the wall; and some of the king’s servants are dead, and your servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.”
verses.ct: but then their archers shot at your soldiers from the top of the wall. Some of your men were killed, and your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead too."

verses.kjv: Then David said unto the messenger, Thus shalt thou say unto Joab, Let not this thing displease thee, for the sword devoureth one as well as another: make thy battle more strong against the city, and overthrow it: and encourage thou him.
verses.web: Then David said to the messenger, “Tell Joab, ‘Don’t let this thing displease you, for the sword devours one as well as another. Make your battle stronger against the city, and overthrow it.’ Encourage him.”
verses.ct: David told the messenger, "Say this to Joab: 'Don't let this upset you — the sword kills one man as easily as another. Press your attack against the city harder and bring it down.' Tell him to keep his spirits up."

verses.kjv: And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
verses.web: When Uriah’s wife heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
verses.ct: When Bathsheba heard that her husband Uriah was dead, she mourned for him.

verses.kjv: And when the mourning was past, David sent and fetched her to his house, and she became his wife, and bare him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased the LORD.
verses.web: When the mourning was past, David sent and took her home to his house, and she became his wife, and bore him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased LORD.
verses.ct: After the time of mourning was over, David had her brought to the palace. She became his wife and gave birth to a son. But the LORD was deeply displeased with what David had done.
